title: What are some important events that led to the French Resistance in WW2? - Quora

response.answer_text: Just a guess, but the surrender of France in June 1940 (Strictly speaking the armistice). It should also be remembered that the French resistance was the collective name for the many and varied groups that opposed German occupation. the motivation also varied greatly, with the different groups sometimes seeing each other as the enemy more than the germans, at least during the early part of the war. If there was any coordination, it was done by the SOE.

Resistance: To push back or to remain stead fast to an ideology, moral or religious belief. The fact is that the Bosh (pigs) could have entered Paris, throwing loving kisses and having the best of intentions for Parisians however, due the fact that one Frenchmen, was to die defending his country would gather resistance. It must be remembered or given consideration that America, being several thousands of miles away from the continent of Europe, that American's, were secured in thought there was great distance and a huge lake separating the two land masses and unless involved directly in battle in WW1, the American had the thought of what happens in Europe, can remain in Europe, (Isolationism) not so for the European, as WW2, was simply an extension of WW1 and there was much bitterness between the French and German, given that they both shared the same border and heavy loss of life in the previous war!
